intro: Hallea rubrostipulata, commonly known as the red-stippled hallea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive red veins on the leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Hallea rubrostipulata is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories.
